intro: Comperia karduchorum, commonly known as the Karduchian bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often covered in a fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Comperia karduchorum is considered a vulnerable species.
